questions.question: What is the primary purpose of HTML forms?
options: To gather information from users and typically post it to a server
questions.explanation: HTML forms are used to gather information from users. The data is typically submitted to a server that processes it, though we'll cover the server-side handling in more detail later.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create an HTML form?
questions.explanation: The <form> tag is the container element that wraps all form controls and defines where the form data should be sent when submitted.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create various types of input fields (text, email, password, checkbox, radio, etc.)?
questions.explanation: The <input> tag is used to create various types of input fields. The type attribute determines what kind of input it is (text, email, password, checkbox, radio, etc.).

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a multi-line text input area?
questions.explanation: The <textarea> tag is used to create a multi-line text input area, allowing users to enter longer text than a single-line input field.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a dropdown menu with selectable options?
questions.explanation: The <select> tag creates a dropdown menu. It contains <option> tags that define the available choices in the dropdown.

questions.question: Which tag is used to define individual options within a <select> dropdown?
questions.explanation: The <option> tag is used inside a <select> element to define each available choice in the dropdown menu.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <label> tag in forms?
options: To provide a text description that is associated with a form control, improving accessibility
questions.explanation: The <label> tag provides a text description for form controls. It improves accessibility (screen readers can associate the label with the input) and usability (clicking the label focuses the input).

questions.question: Which tag is commonly used to create a submit button in a form?
questions.explanation: You can create a submit button using either <button type="submit"> or <input type="submit">. Both will submit the form when clicked.

questions.question: What attribute of the <input> tag determines what type of input field is created?
questions.explanation: The type attribute of the <input> tag determines what kind of input field is created. Examples include: text, email, password, checkbox, radio, submit, etc.

questions.question: Which of the following are common form-related HTML tags?
questions.explanation: Common form-related tags include: <form> (container), <input> (various input types), <textarea> (multi-line text), <select> and <option> (dropdowns), <label> (labels), and <button> (buttons).
